definition: Friedrich Engels (1820-1895), socialist philosopher and one of the founder of Marxism
favor/grace/kindness
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively
(phonetic)/this
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: "Summary" of Marx and Engels had never advocated the principle of democratic centralism .
sentences.chinese: 馬克思恩格斯從未倡導過民主集中制原則。

sentences.english: Marx and Engels were the first socialists to support trade unions.
sentences.chinese: 率先支持工會運動的社會主義者也是馬克思和恩格斯。

sentences.english: Engels pointed out that historical materialism is not only the world outlook but also the methodology.
sentences.chinese: 恩格斯指出，唯物史觀不僅是世界視，而且是方法論。

sentences.english: She was shattered when she heard about the scandal of illegitimacy from Engels on his deathbed.
sentences.chinese: 當恩格斯臨終時告訴她私生子的醜聞時，她崩潰了。

sentences.english: Engels and Lenin use the concept of absolute truth in different context.
sentences.chinese: 恩格斯和列寧是在不同的論域中使用絕對真理概念的。

sentences.english: Engels once compared taxes to the wet nurse of the government.
sentences.chinese: 恩格斯曾把賦稅比作政府的乳孃。

sentences.english: This proposition was Engles' further development of Hegel's thought.
sentences.chinese: 這一命題是恩格斯對黑格爾思想的進一步發展。

David Hume (1711-1776), Scottish Enlightenment philosopher
Smith (name)/also rendered as 史密斯
Nikolai Ivanovich Bukharin (1888-1938), Soviet revolutionary theorist, executed after a show trial in 1937
Jean-Jacques Rousseau (1712-1778), Enlightenment philosopher
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Charles Montesquieu (1689-1755), French political philosopher
